name: Intro
_source: s;Luther;Indeed.{w}{br}The Morrissey family has spent centuries building and protecting this castle.
s;Luther;It's fortunate that Lord Morrissey allowed our entry.{w}{br}He is notoriously risk-averse.
s;Vincent;Do you think he'll hear us out?{w}{br}I've heard House Morrissey rarely deploys its troops...{w}{br}So it might be a tough sell getting help retaking our home.
s;Simon;I'm not sure.{w}{br}But we need his support.{w}{br}This is probably the strongest standing noble house.{w}{br}All of my father's old allies have fallen into ruin...
s;Juliet;Maybe emphasize that then?{w}{br}Morrissey probably has an interest in keeping the noble houses around.

s;Luther;You should also make the case for what we offer to him.{w}{br}House Verstadt may not have the same power as House Morrissey,{w}{br}but we safeguarded a key road leading to the capital.{w}{br}This may appeal to House Morrissey's focus on trade.
s;Simon;Thanks, everyone.{w}{br}This has given me a lot to think about.{w}{br}I'll see if I can find Lord Morrissey.{w}{br}Wish me luck.
s;Juliet;Well, while you go talk to Morrissey, I'll poke around the castle.{w}{br}Let me know what he says!
s;Luther;Vincent, let's wait here while Lord Verstadt speaks to Lord Morrissey.{w}{br}I'm sure we'd only interfere.
s;Simon;Wait... {w}Ugh.{w}{br}This negotiation business was always my least favorite part of the job...
